qas.question: When does the middle of summer occur on Cyprus?
What is the average day temperature on the coast during summer?
What is the average day temperature on the coast in June and September?
Where are temperatures more extreme compared to the coast of Cyprus?

context: The middle of summer is hot – in <a0_0>July and August<a0_0/> on the coast the average temperature is usually around <a1_0>33 °C (91 °F)<a1_0/> during the day and around 22 °C (72 °F) at night (inland, in the highlands average temperature exceeds 35 °C (95 °F)) while in the June and September on the coast the average temperature is usually around <a2_0>30 °C (86 °F)<a2_0/> during the day and around 20 °C (68 °F) at night in Limassol, while is usually around 28 °C (82 °F) during the day and around 18 °C (64 °F) at night in Paphos. Large fluctuations in temperature are rare. <a3_0>Inland<a3_0/> temperatures are more extreme, with colder winters and hotter summers compared with the coast of the island.
